jobs.title: Device Identification
jobs.body: Participant will be required to identify the features of a computer and record the name next to the correct letter.

items.statement: How to identify various features of a computer?
How to use correct tools and safely perform procedures to diagnose a computer and document systems?
How to install NIC into a computer on the correct driver from the provided media?
How to configure NIC to automatically obtain an IP address for a network device using a command line?
How to ping the IP address?
How to connect the machine and transfer file?

A/An _____ is a small piece of software that piggybacks on other programs.
A software patch is a

choices.body: small piece of computer program code that replaces a part of software already installed
software that is designed to covertly infiltrate or damage a computer system
computer program that scans and attempts recovery of bad sectors on a computer's hard drive
utility that detects and protects a personal computer from unauthorized access

choices.body: checks the network path from the host to a website

maintain a log of all users who access a computer's hard drive

questions.body: The _____ is an example of firmware.

choices.body: corrects the date and time setting when the CMOS battery is low
upgrades a P3 Intel processor to emulate an Intel P4 processor
increases the speed and functionality of Intel processors only
temporarily increases the speed and functionality of a processor

choices.body: reinstall the printer with a different driver

What is a hot spot?

choices.body: a location allowing wired connections to a wireless network
a computer network covering a small physical area
public locations where wireless Internet access is available
a device for connecting multiple fiber optic Ethernet devices together to make them act as a single network segment

questions.body: The IP address 192.168.0.1 is an example of what type of address?

A customer calls and tells the computer technician their DSL Internet is running slow.  The customer has rebooted the computer and it's still slow as well as other computers through the wired and wireless connection within the house.  What is the <u>first</u>  step the technician should advise the customer to take?

choices.body: have the customer power cycle the DSL modem
have the customer try accessing the Internet through WIFI on their Smartphone
have the customer try accessing the Internet in Safe Mode on the PC
have the customer call the DSL company

questions.body: A system designed to prevent unauthorized access to or from a private network is known as a/an
A malicious program that presents itself as a legitimate program is a
Which of the following prevents, detects, and removes viruses, worms, and Trojans?

A technician has just finished adding more RAM to a customer's computer.  The RAM costs $85.23 and the technician took 1.5 hours to complete the upgrade.  Labor costs are $25.50 per hour.  The customer has a coupon for 15 percent off the cost of parts and labor.  The total bill before taxes would be
How should a computer handle an upset customer who called for technical support to ensure customer satisfaction and to maintain professionalism?

choices.body: The technician should listen to the customer until they have explained the situation, then calmly acknowledge their frustration, and let the customer know that he or she will do their very best to resolve the situation.
The technician should interrupt the customer and politely tell them to call back when they have calmed down.
The technician should place the customer on hold and wait a couple minutes for the customer to cool off.
The technician should place the customer on hold and transfer the call to their supervisor.

questions.body: When working with other technicians, why is it important to maintain thorough documentation?

choices.body: It ensures all technicians have access to the same information.
It is a government policy that companies have to adhere to.
It ensures a well-rounded job experience for all technicians.
It is a required part of every technician's job.

resources.name: Andrews, J. (2010). A+ guide to managing and maintaining your PC. (7th Ed.). Clifton Park, NY: Delmar Cengage Learning.
Argier, C. (2013). How to safely clean an LCD flat screen TV screen or computer monitor.
Chiappetta, M. (2013). PC world: How to install a CPU cooler.
U.S. Department of Labor Occupational Safety & Health Administration. (2013). Computer workstations – Monitors: OSHA ergonomic solutions.
U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. (2013). Wastes- resource conservation- common wastes and materials – ecycling.

competencies.body: Install, configure, optimize, and upgrade system board, power supplies, and cooling systems
Differentiate characteristics of various processor and memory types
Identify and configure CMOS setup and BIOS
Identify functionality, install, and configure storage device options
Identify and describe characteristics of various peripherals and ports used
Display knowledge of different operating systems and licensing requirements

competencies.body: Diagnose and identify processor and memory faults
Demonstrate ability to isolate and resolve power supply and battery failures on the system board
Display ability to identify and resolve storage device issues

Troubleshoot and resolve expansion card issues (drivers)
Demonstrate ability to setup and troubleshoot external display
Identify tools, diagnostic procedures, and troubleshooting techniques for operating system
Demonstrate ability to isolate and resolve peripheral and connectivity failures
Utilize command line techniques for diagnosing and troubleshooting
Demonstrate the proper use of multimeters and other test equipment
Identify basic electrical, transmission, and storage units of measurement
